reviews.review_msg: Natalia is a kind person, but I feel as though prospective students should be informed on what she endorses. This professor is vocally pro generative AI, to the point that she stated it was mandatory for assignments & to ask it questions class discussions. She encourages pasting chatGPT summaries of material to canvas. I find this morally wrong.
An amazing Vygotskian scholar and child psychologist. The best professor I have had in my masters program. I would highly recommend her.

she rambles too much and it's easy to snooze in her lecture (which can be very long btw). She's a super super easy marker. attendence is mandatory but it feels like a waste of time to even go (but i recommend just sitting there and doing other coursework). Particpation matters in class just cuz it'll be quiet otherwise and not fun
best prof ever

Natalia is a wonderful professor who cares deeply about not only the material she teaches but also the students themselves. I learned a ton in her class through her practical applications of the educational curriculums we were taught, with the roleplays and group work we did in seminars. The readings provided excellent discussions in class as well.

It was a pleasure to take her class. I found the material extremely difficult since I had training in other areas (i.e. Economics). However, she knows the content well, and it is easy to grasp after her explanations and guided discussions. She is a very rare Professor as she has a deep understanding of Marxism, politics, and philosophy in general.
Really enjoyed the class. She knows her stuff!

I'm not an Education major, but I learned so much from Natalia.  She opened my eyes to different types of culture of curriculums.  Don't be afraid that she does not have lecture notes for class, she doesn't need them! Its refreshing to have a prof like her.  It's a really fun class and you'll learn things beyond the classroom.

She is an amazing teacher; my major is not education, but she really opened up my eyes to curriculum and implementing change. One of the best profs in my University career, seriously, don't take this class with anyone else.
You don't need to do very much work outside of class to do well, it's mostly just in-class participation. So impressive though, completely made me rethink my views on education - for the better!
One of the best course I've taken at SFU. Love the way the class is structured where it is not time-consuming and a great deal of concepts is learned! Prof is funny, kind and caring!
Great course!

This is the best class I've taken in my 4 years of undergraduate studies. I've learned the most from this professor than any others and she not only taught from her book, but she taught us from her life. Her life experience is one of the most interesting and educational to learn from. She is also a great mentor, always wishing the best for students

THE BEST class I have ever taken at SFU. This is the only time I can say that my $600 was well spent at SFU. She is the most caring, generous, and knowledgeable professor I have ever had the privilege to learn from. The text was a bore, but she brought it to life in her comedy filled lectures. The hardest part of the course: registering for it!
She's very easy-marking.  Attend all her classes and read the textbook, you'll be no problem.
Awesome prof, I would recommend taking her class just because she is great!
She's Great!!!
great prof I ever had! enjoy her class so much and had a good result at the end of the term:)

She is the most amazing professor I've ever had in post-secondary. She has very strong opinion about few things but she likes the challenge so you can make a nice discussion session. Highly recommend to take class with her.

So incredibly inspiring. Natalia walked into class with littel else than her coffee (or apple juice) and her years of experience to provoke the most stimulating conversation and to challenge our spontaneous conceptions of the meaning of education.

While in Natalia's class I learned more than in any other university class. She took time, patient & enthusiasiasm to make sure we understand the material. Her goal was centered on students' best. Her passion for teaching/learning combined with her infinate knowledge on Vygotsky resulted in excellent class dynamics. A Vygotskian scholoar/teacher.

I was eager to learn about Vygotsky, and Natalia made it a pleasure - she had all of the good "gossip."  I liked that she discussed most topics first, then allowed us to do the reading.  It really helped me to understand what might have been quite difficult.  I think it's a mark of how good a prof Natalia is that I found the subject so interesting!

Although I was not excited about taking a course on Vygotsky, Natalia made the course interesting and even entertaining at times!  I learned more then I had planned to, and even ended up enjoying the class!  I would definitely recommend Natalia as a fantastic instructor to anyone!

The easiest class i've ever had! However, don't expect you can learn a whole lot from this class coz you only need to have the basic knowledge from the lower level educ classes. i admit that i didn't study the text at all but still manage to get an A. Recommended to any lazy student like me.

Disliked this class so much that I stopped going. The first 30mins of every class was monopolized by certain students agruing with prof over course content and direction. A lot of lecturing, textbooks were boring, class 4hours long and most of the material I learned in first year psychology class. I don't feel I got anything valuable from this clas
i recommend taking this course with this prof, she's very nice and understanding, topics covered are interesting, textbooks are not hard to read...

This was a very different experience, as we did most of the work on-line. I felt a little uneasy about how we would be graded, as it was not really clear. In the end, I think we all got A's though, so I was happy! I just wish I knew not to worry about it!
Excellent prof! She could hand out the graded assignments sooner and participate in online discussions more often. Overall, she is worth checking out!
